title: Retry Policies (What to Retry, What Not To)
description: A short lesson to help you apply Retry Policies (What to Retry, What Not To).

hook.text: Not everything should be retriedâ€”especially side effects.

buildup.text: Retry only when a retry can realistically change the outcome.

discovery.text: Practical rule: retry reads more than writes, and make writes idempotent.

twist.text: Retries + non-idempotent writes create duplicates and incidents.

climax.text: A good retry policy is a safety feature: it prevents runaway behavior and duplicated work.

quiz.question: What should you be careful retrying?
